intro: Lomatophyllum namorokaense, commonly known as the Namoroka lomatophyllum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its distinctive, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
